item.title: Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires
item.description:
Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires

Thirty years after the Chernobyl disaster, firefighters remain on high alert to prevent radioactive forest fires. Originally published at - http://www.rferl.org/media/video/guarding-against-chernobyls-radioactive-forest-fires/27691519.html

item.description:
A Turning Point for China?

In this film, William Nee discusses what it's like doing human rights work in China today, and tells the story of Pu Zhiqiang, one of China's most famous fre...

item.title: Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square
item.description:
Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square

Performance artist Roman Roslovtsev returned to Red Square to stage his latest masked protest against Russian President Vladimir Putin and a law on public ga...

item.title: Former American Detainee Says North Korea Tried to Use Him as Negotiating Tool
item.description:
Former American Detainee Says North Korea Tried to Use Him as Negotiating Tool

Kenneth Bae, an American missionary who was detained in North Korea for more than two years, said Pyongyang tried to use him as a political bargaining chip. In a rare interview with VOA's Korean service last Friday, Bae described in detail the ordeal that made him the longest-held American by the North since the Korean War.

item.title: Pakistan: No Military Action Against Afghan Taliban on Its Soil
item.description:
Pakistan: No Military Action Against Afghan Taliban on Its Soil

Pakistan is rejecting Afghan demands for military action against Taliban commanders within Pakistan and emphasizes the need to continue talks for a settlement to the conflict in Afghanistan. In Islamabad Tuesday, Pakistani foreign policy adviser Sartaj Aziz dismissed demands by Afghan President Ashraf Ghani that Pakistan evict Taliban insurgents through military action or arrest and hand them over to Kabul for trial and punishment for killing innocent Afghans.

item.title: Huge Fire Adds to Woes for Myanmar's Rohingya Muslims
item.description:
Huge Fire Adds to Woes for Myanmar's Rohingya Muslims

Nearly 450 Rohingya Muslims are homeless after a huge fire burned down several shelters at a camp for internally displaced people Tuesday. About 50 shelters were destroyed at the Baw Du Pa camp located near Sittwe, the capital of the western state of Rakhine.

item.title: Russia: Aleppo Cease-Fire in Syria Could Come Soon
item.description:
Russia: Aleppo Cease-Fire in Syria Could Come Soon

Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said Tuesday that a cease-fire could be announced within hours to halt fighting between rebels and government forces in Aleppo, Syria, even as new clashes left at least 14 dead.

item.title: Hungary to Hold EU Migrant Quota Referendum by October
item.description:
Hungary to Hold EU Migrant Quota Referendum by October

Hungary will hold a referendum in September or early October on whether to accept any future European Union quota system for resettling migrants, the prime minister's office said on Tuesday. Prime Minister Viktor Orban has taken an increasingly anti-immigrant stance since the migration crisis escalated last year and opposes a plan, agreed by a majority of EU governments in September, to redistribute 160,000 migrants around the bloc.
